717553f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 50th Street (West)
717553f-a.text:
Broadway, at and adjoining the S.E. corner of West 50th Street. Also
shown is West 50th Street, north side, east from, but not including Broadway,
to and including Sixth Ave. At the N.E. corner of Seventh Ave., and West
50th Street, is the Roxy Theatre, housed in the Hotel Manger (now the Hotel
Taft).
July 23, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717549f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 50th Street
717549f-a.text:
Broadway at the S.W. corner of 50th Street. The three-story
building shown will be replaced by a four-story structure.
February 5, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717548f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 50th Street
717548f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, north from and including 50th Street
(incorrectly marked 48th Street on the face of the picture). The
centre building is the American Horse Exchange, which within the
next decade will be replaced by the Winter Garden Theatre.
March 18, 1901.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
William B. Parsons Collection.
M..~ 2So9

717550f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 50th Street
717550f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, west side, north from, but not including, 50th Street.
The theatres shown are the Capitol, the Hollywood, and the Broadway,
in its new location.
NEG ~ 87e  October 1, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A more inclusive view, showing in addition the N.W. corner of West
50th Street.
NEG~ 5E2  October 1, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3 and 4)
The same. The Capitol Theatre (Motion Picture) is at No. 1645
Broadway. This set consists of a positive and negative copy.
October to December 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717551f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 50th Street
717551f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, north from, but not including, 50th
Street.
May 3, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717557f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 50th Street
717557f-a.text:
1639-1647 Broadway, west side, between 50th and 51st Streets.
Between 1916 and 1920 this frame building will be replaced by the
Capitol Theatre.
February 25, 1904.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

713482f-a.text:
t1)
50th Street, east from and including Broadway, showing the
70 storied R. C. A. Building under construotion at Rockefeller

717554f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 50th Street
717554f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, from 50th to 51st Streets, showing the
Winter Garden Theatre flanked by buildings of three and twelve
stories, respectively.
May 3, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2,and 3)
A similar view, more extensive southward. The Winter Garden
Theatre bears No. 1634 Broadway. This set consists of a negative and
a positive.
November 29, 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
